thread.title: Pets, music, food and more at first-ever Bark-Toberfest
thread.title_full: Pets, music, food and more at first-ever Bark-Toberfest

title: Pets, music, food and more at first-ever Bark-Toberfest
text:
Pets, music, food and more at first-ever Bark-Toberfest Julinana Goodwin, For the News-Leader 10:56 p.m. CDT October 21, 2015 Buy a doo-rag for your pet Saturday at the Sequiota Bike Shop’s fundraising event for the Humane Society. Proceeds benefit the society. (Photo: submitted photo) 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Enjoy a beer on the lawn, listen to live music and support the Humane Society at Sequiota Bike Shop’s first fall festival: Bark-Toberfest. 
Tom Muetzel, who co-owns Sequiota Bike Shop, said admission to the family-friendly event is free, but people are asked to bring food or cleaning supplies to donate to the Humane Society of Southwest Missouri. Those who do will receive drink and food tickets to exchange for lemonade, tea, hot dogs or hamburgers that will be grilled during the event. You can purchase food and drink tickets and those proceeds go to the Humane Society. 
Bark-Toberfest is from noon to 7 p.m. Saturday at 3521 S. Lone Pine, and includes live music by Brookline Station as well as the Nobo’s. Bring a lawn chair or blanket. 
There will be a pet costume contest and other games. 
Representatives from Humane Society will be on hand and there will be pets available for adoption. 
Summit Brewing Co., out of Minneapolis, will sell beer. The bike shop will have its regular menu, too. 
Muetzel said he and his business partner and many friends all have rescue pets which is why they wanted to organize this event. 
Also, a lot of their customers are dog lovers who bring their dogs out the sandwich shop. 
“The response has been huge,” he said. “Social media has been very kind to us. So much to the point I am rounding up extra tables.” 
Want to go? 
Bark-toberfest is from noon to 7 p.m. Saturday at Sequiota Bike Shop, 3521 S. Lone Pine. Bring a lawn chair or blanket. Live music. Admission is free. It’s a fundraiser for the Humane Society so bring cleaning supplies or pet food or cash to donate. Call 881-4488 or check updates on Facebook:
